summary: This document is an index of records withheld in full by the Bureau of Prisons in response to a FOIA lawsuit by The New York Times. It lists 60 categories of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration, his apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and his death by suicide on August 10, 2019, citing various FOIA exemptions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose apparent suicide attempt and subsequent death are the subject of all withheld documents.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's apparent suicide attempt while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), triggering numerous incident reports, photo sheets, and investigative documents.

events.title: Epstein's Death by Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), leading to a massive internal investigation and documentation effort by the BOP.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons is withholding a vast array of documents (over 60 categories) related to Epstein's incarceration and death, citing FOIA exemptions 5, 6, 7(A), 7(C), 7(E), and 7(F).
The withheld material includes detailed records of an 'apparent suicide attempt' by Epstein on July 23, 2019, nearly three weeks before his death.
Documents include psychological reconstructions of the death, overtime logs, staff assignment rosters, investigative reports, medical records, photo sheets, and thousands of internal emails.
The index reveals the scale of the BOP's internal investigation and monitoring, including 'TRUINTEL' reports, suicide watch logs, psych observation logs, and 30-minute check sheets.
The filing is part of the case 'New York Times v. BOP', indicating media efforts to obtain information about the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.
